text.p: The following are top stories from selected Singapore newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Singapore Prime Minister Goh Chok Tong likely to decide date of Singapore's General Election after his visit to opposition-held Hougang next Sunday.
- Singapore Prime Minister Goh Chok Tong and Senior Minister Lee Kuan Yew urge voters to back People's Action Party teams in Group Representation Constituencies.
- White tiger in popular Indonesian safari park attacks and kills Malaysian woman minutes after she poses for picture with animal.
- Site in Boon Lay is first executive condominium parcel to be tendered out publicly to developers early next year.
- Land set aside for residential development in Jurong West expected to double by 2010.
- Prices of hard disk drives shoot up 20-40 percent due to increased demand from systems integrators, computer vendors and retail buyers.
- Wall Street market strategists predict volatile conditions in coming weeks and fear global markets will perform poorly in first quarter.
- Boeing and McDonnel Douglas announce they would merge in stock wrap to create world's largest aircraft company and mammoth in aviation, aerospace and defence.
- Listed transport-based Singapore Bus Service's mega-venture with Malaysia's Renong group to build buses has hit a speed hump.
- Singapore stock market retains its neutral weighting as concerns in exchange about near-term growth outlook for country lingers.
- Analysts say firms may be pushed to list sooner rather than later to match IPOs with their fiscal year.
